newsitem.title: LEBANON: Intercontinental opens first of 6 Lebanon projects.
newsitem.headline: Intercontinental opens first of 6 Lebanon projects.

text.p: Japanese-owned Intercontinental Hotels has launched the first of six hotels and resorts it plans to open in Lebanon in the next three years.
The Vendome Intercontinental, a luxury hotel aimed at senior executives, reopened this month on the Beirut seafront after a 13-year shutdown and an $11.5 million facelift.
"This is the first of six hotels opening in the next three years in Lebanon with Intercontinental," general manager Francois Chopinet told Reuters.

Intercontinental Hotels and Resorts, one of the world's largest chains, will also manage the nearby Phoenicia Intercontinental, a Forum Hotel to be built by 1998, two tourist resorts and another hotel or resort still to be decided.
Infrastructure work has begun on the Forum and the Phoenicia's $80 million renovation should begin in January and last for 18 months, Chopinet said.
Vendome's owners, Societe des Grands Hotels du Liban (SGHL), signed the management contract with Intercontinental in May 1995.
The refurbishment was financed by a $90-million debt and equity package which will also cover the restoration of the Phoenicia Intercontinental.
The package was arranged by Beirut investment house Lebanon Invest on behalf of SGHL which owns the Phoenicia and 97 percent of the Vendome.
